Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/oqmgr/qmgr_deliver.c

1/* $NetBSD: qmgr_deliver.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:46 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* qmgr_deliver 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* deliver one per-site queue entry to that site
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include "qmgr.h"
10/*
11/* int qmgr_deliver_concurrency;
12/*
13/* int qmgr_deliver(transport, fp)
14/* QMGR_TRANSPORT *transport;
15/* VSTREAM *fp;
16/* DESCRIPTION
17/* This module implements the client side of the `queue manager
18/* to delivery agent' protocol. The queue manager uses
19/* asynchronous I/O so that it can drive multiple delivery
20/* agents in parallel. Depending on the outcome of a delivery
21/* attempt, the status of messages, queues and transports is
22/* updated.
23/*
24/* qmgr_deliver_concurrency is a global counter that says how
25/* many delivery processes are in use. This can be used, for
26/* example, to control the size of the `active' message queue.
27/*
28/* qmgr_deliver() executes when a delivery process announces its
29/* availability for the named transport. It arranges for delivery
30/* of a suitable queue entry. The \fIfp\fR argument specifies a
31/* stream that is connected to the delivery process, or a null
32/* pointer if the transport accepts no connection. Upon completion
33/* of delivery (successful or not), the stream is closed, so that the
34/* delivery process is released.
35/* DIAGNOSTICS
36/* LICENSE
37/* .ad
38/* .fi
39/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
40/* AUTHOR(S)
41/* Wietse Venema
42/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
43/* P.O. Box 704
44/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
45/*
46/* Wietse Venema
47/* Google, Inc.
48/* 111 8th Avenue
49/* New York, NY 10011, USA
50/*--*/
51
52/* System library. */
53
54#include <sys_defs.h>
55#include <time.h>
56#include <string.h>
57
58/* Utility library. */
59
60#include <msg.h>
61#include <vstring.h>
62#include <vstream.h>
63#include <vstring_vstream.h>
64#include <events.h>
65#include <iostuff.h>
66#include <stringops.h>
67#include <mymalloc.h>
68
69/* Global library. */
70
71#include <mail_queue.h>
72#include <mail_proto.h>
73#include <recipient_list.h>
74#include <mail_params.h>
75#include <deliver_request.h>
76#include <verp_sender.h>
77#include <dsn_util.h>
78#include <dsn_buf.h>
79#include <dsb_scan.h>
80#include <rcpt_print.h>
81#include <smtputf8.h>
82
83/* Application-specific. */
84
85#include "qmgr.h"
86
87 /*
88 * Important note on the _transport_rate_delay implementation: after
89 * qmgr_transport_alloc() sets the QMGR_TRANSPORT_STAT_RATE_LOCK flag, all
90 * code paths must directly or indirectly invoke qmgr_transport_unthrottle()
91 * or qmgr_transport_throttle(). Otherwise, transports with non-zero
92 * _transport_rate_delay will become stuck.
93 */
94
95int qmgr_deliver_concurrency;
96
97 /*
98 * Message delivery status codes.
99 */
100#define DELIVER_STAT_OK 0 /* all recipients delivered */
101#define DELIVER_STAT_DEFER 1 /* try some recipients later */
102#define DELIVER_STAT_CRASH 2 /* mailer internal problem */
103
104/* qmgr_deliver_initial_reply - retrieve initial delivery process response */
105
106static int qmgr_deliver_initial_reply(VSTREAM *stream)
107{
108 int stat;
109
110 if (peekfd(vstream_fileno(stream)) < 0) {
111 msg_warn("%s: premature disconnect", VSTREAM_PATH(stream));
112 return (DELIVER_STAT_CRASH);
113 } else if (attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
114 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_STATUS, &stat),
115 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 1) {
116 msg_warn("%s: malformed response", VSTREAM_PATH(stream));
117 return (DELIVER_STAT_CRASH);
118 } else {
119 return (stat ? DELIVER_STAT_DEFER : 0);
120 }
121}
122
123/* qmgr_deliver_final_reply - retrieve final delivery process response */
124
125static int qmgr_deliver_final_reply(VSTREAM *stream, DSN_BUF *dsb)
126{
127 int stat;
128
129 if (peekfd(vstream_fileno(stream)) < 0) {
130 msg_warn("%s: premature disconnect", VSTREAM_PATH(stream));
131 return (DELIVER_STAT_CRASH);
132 } else if (attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
133 RECV_ATTR_FUNC(dsb_scan, (void *) dsb),
134 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_STATUS, &stat),
135 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 2) {
136 msg_warn("%s: malformed response", VSTREAM_PATH(stream));
137 return (DELIVER_STAT_CRASH);
138 } else {
139 return (stat ? DELIVER_STAT_DEFER : 0);
140 }
141}
142
143/* qmgr_deliver_send_request - send delivery request to delivery process */
144
145static int qmgr_deliver_send_request(QMGR_ENTRY *entry, VSTREAM *stream)
146{
147 RECIPIENT_LIST list = entry->rcpt_list;
148 RECIPIENT *recipient;
149 QMGR_MESSAGE *message = entry->message;
150 VSTRING *sender_buf = 0;
151 MSG_STATS stats;
152 char *sender;
153 int flags;
154 int smtputf8 = message->smtputf8;
155 const char *addr;
156
157 /*
158 * Todo: integrate with code up-stream that builds the delivery request.
159 */
160 for (recipient = list.info; recipient < list.info + list.len; recipient++)
161 if (var_smtputf8_enable && (addr = recipient->address)[0]
162 && !allascii(addr) && valid_utf8_string(addr, strlen(addr))) {
163 smtputf8 |= SMTPUTF8_FLAG_RECIPIENT;
164 if (message->verp_delims)
165 smtputf8 |= SMTPUTF8_FLAG_SENDER;
166 }
167
168 /*
169 * If variable envelope return path is requested, change prefix+@origin
170 * into prefix+user=domain@origin. Note that with VERP there is only one
171 * recipient per delivery.
172 */
173 if (message->verp_delims == 0) {
174 sender = message->sender;
175 } else {
176 sender_buf = vstring_alloc(100);
177 verp_sender(sender_buf, message->verp_delims,
178 message->sender, list.info);
179 sender = vstring_str(sender_buf);
180 }
181
182 flags = message->tflags
183 | entry->queue->dflags
184 | (message->inspect_xport ? DEL_REQ_FLAG_BOUNCE : DEL_REQ_FLAG_DEFLT);
185 (void) QMGR_MSG_STATS(&stats, message);
186 attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
187 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_FLAGS, flags),
188 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_QUEUE, message->queue_name),
189 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_QUEUEID, message->queue_id),
190 SEND_ATTR_LONG(MAIL_ATTR_OFFSET, message->data_offset),
191 SEND_ATTR_LONG(MAIL_ATTR_SIZE, message->cont_length),
192 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_NEXTHOP, entry->queue->nexthop),
193 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_ENCODING, message->encoding),
194 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_SMTPUTF8, smtputf8),
195 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_SENDER, sender),
196 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_DSN_ENVID, message->dsn_envid),
197 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_DSN_RET, message->dsn_ret),
198 SEND_ATTR_FUNC(msg_stats_print, (void *) &stats),
199 /* XXX Should be encapsulated with ATTR_TYPE_FUNC. */
200 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_NAME, message->client_name),
201 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_ADDR, message->client_addr),
202 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_PORT, message->client_port),
203 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_PROTO_NAME, message->client_proto),
204 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_HELO_NAME, message->client_helo),
205 /* XXX Should be encapsulated with ATTR_TYPE_FUNC. */
206 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_SASL_METHOD, message->sasl_method),
207 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_SASL_USERNAME, message->sasl_username),
208 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_SASL_SENDER, message->sasl_sender),
209 /* XXX Ditto if we want to pass TLS certificate info. */
210 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_IDENT, message->log_ident),
211 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_RWR_CONTEXT, message->rewrite_context),
212 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_RCPT_COUNT, list.len),
213 ATTR_TYPE_END);
214 if (sender_buf != 0)
215 vstring_free(sender_buf);
216 for (recipient = list.info; recipient < list.info + list.len; recipient++)
217 attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
218 SEND_ATTR_FUNC(rcpt_print, (void *) recipient),
219 ATTR_TYPE_END);
220 if (vstream_fflush(stream) != 0) {
221 msg_warn("write to process (%s): %m", entry->queue->transport->name);
222 return (-1);
223 } else {
224 if (msg_verbose)
225 msg_info("qmgr_deliver: site `%s'", entry->queue->name);
226 return (0);
227 }
228}
229
230/* qmgr_deliver_abort - transport response watchdog */
231
232static void qmgr_deliver_abort(int unused_event, void *context)
233{
234 QMGR_ENTRY *entry = (QMGR_ENTRY *) context;
235 QMGR_QUEUE *queue = entry->queue;
236 QMGR_TRANSPORT *transport = queue->transport;
237 QMGR_MESSAGE *message = entry->message;
238
239 msg_fatal("%s: timeout receiving delivery status from transport: %s",
240 message->queue_id, transport->name);
241}
242
243/* qmgr_deliver_update - process delivery status report */
244
245static void qmgr_deliver_update(int unused_event, void *context)
246{
247 QMGR_ENTRY *entry = (QMGR_ENTRY *) context;
248 QMGR_QUEUE *queue = entry->queue;
249 QMGR_TRANSPORT *transport = queue->transport;
250 QMGR_MESSAGE *message = entry->message;
251 static DSN_BUF *dsb;
252 int status;
253
254 /*
255 * Release the delivery agent from a "hot" queue entry.
256 */
257#define QMGR_DELIVER_RELEASE_AGENT(entry) do { \
258 event_disable_readwrite(vstream_fileno(entry->stream)); \
259 (void) vstream_fclose(entry->stream); \
260 entry->stream = 0; \
261 qmgr_deliver_concurrency--; \
262 } while (0)
263
264 if (dsb == 0)
265 dsb = dsb_create();
266
267 /*
268 * The message transport has responded. Stop the watchdog timer.
269 */
270 event_cancel_timer(qmgr_deliver_abort, context);
271
272 /*
273 * Retrieve the delivery agent status report. The numerical status code
274 * indicates if delivery should be tried again. The reason text is sent
275 * only when a site should be avoided for a while, so that the queue
276 * manager can log why it does not even try to schedule delivery to the
277 * affected recipients.
278 */
279 status = qmgr_deliver_final_reply(entry->stream, dsb);
280
281 /*
282 * The mail delivery process failed for some reason (although delivery
283 * may have been successful). Back off with this transport type for a
284 * while. Dispose of queue entries for this transport that await
285 * selection (the todo lists). Stay away from queue entries that have
286 * been selected (the busy lists), or we would have dangling pointers.
287 * The queue itself won't go away before we dispose of the current queue
288 * entry.
289 */
290 if (status == DELIVER_STAT_CRASH) {
291 message->flags |= DELIVER_STAT_DEFER;
292#if 0
293 whatsup = concatenate("unknown ", transport->name,
294 " mail transport error", (char *) 0);
295 qmgr_transport_throttle(transport,
296 DSN_SIMPLE(&dsb->dsn, "4.3.0", whatsup));
297 myfree(whatsup);
298#else
299 qmgr_transport_throttle(transport,
300 DSN_SIMPLE(&dsb->dsn, "4.3.0",
301 "unknown mail transport error"));
302#endif
303 msg_warn("transport %s failure -- see a previous warning/fatal/panic logfile record for the problem description",
304 transport->name);
305
306 /*
307 * Assume the worst and write a defer logfile record for each
308 * recipient. This omission was already present in the first queue
309 * manager implementation of 199703, and was fixed 200511.
310 *
311 * To avoid the synchronous qmgr_defer_recipient() operation for each
312 * recipient of this queue entry, release the delivery process and
313 * move the entry back to the todo queue. Let qmgr_defer_transport()
314 * log the recipient asynchronously if possible, and get out of here.
315 * Note: if asynchronous logging is not possible,
316 * qmgr_defer_transport() eventually invokes qmgr_entry_done() and
317 * the entry becomes a dangling pointer.
318 */
319 QMGR_DELIVER_RELEASE_AGENT(entry);
320 qmgr_entry_unselect(queue, entry);
321 qmgr_defer_transport(transport, &dsb->dsn);
322 return;
323 }
324
325 /*
326 * This message must be tried again.
327 *
328 * If we have a problem talking to this site, back off with this site for a
329 * while; dispose of queue entries for this site that await selection
330 * (the todo list); stay away from queue entries that have been selected
331 * (the busy list), or we would have dangling pointers. The queue itself
332 * won't go away before we dispose of the current queue entry.
333 *
334 * XXX Caution: DSN_COPY() will panic on empty status or reason.
335 */
336#define SUSPENDED "delivery temporarily suspended: "
337
338 if (status == DELIVER_STAT_DEFER) {
339 message->flags |= DELIVER_STAT_DEFER;
340 if (VSTRING_LEN(dsb->status)) {
341 /* Sanitize the DSN status/reason from the delivery agent. */
342 if (!dsn_valid(vstring_str(dsb->status)))
343 vstring_strcpy(dsb->status, "4.0.0");
344 if (VSTRING_LEN(dsb->reason) == 0)
345 vstring_strcpy(dsb->reason, "unknown error");
346 vstring_prepend(dsb->reason, SUSPENDED, sizeof(SUSPENDED) - 1);
347 if (QMGR_QUEUE_READY(queue)) {
348 qmgr_queue_throttle(queue, DSN_FROM_DSN_BUF(dsb));
349 if (QMGR_QUEUE_THROTTLED(queue))
350 qmgr_defer_todo(queue, &dsb->dsn);
351 }
352 }
353 }
354
355 /*
356 * No problems detected. Mark the transport and queue as alive. The queue
357 * itself won't go away before we dispose of the current queue entry.
358 */
359 if (status != DELIVER_STAT_CRASH) {
360 qmgr_transport_unthrottle(transport);
361 if (VSTRING_LEN(dsb->reason) == 0)
362 qmgr_queue_unthrottle(queue);
363 }
364
365 /*
366 * Release the delivery process, and give some other queue entry a chance
367 * to be delivered. When all recipients for a message have been tried,
368 * decide what to do next with this message: defer, bounce, delete.
369 */
370 QMGR_DELIVER_RELEASE_AGENT(entry);
371 qmgr_entry_done(entry, QMGR_QUEUE_BUSY);
372}
373
374/* qmgr_deliver - deliver one per-site queue entry */
375
376void qmgr_deliver(QMGR_TRANSPORT *transport, VSTREAM *stream)
377{
378 QMGR_QUEUE *queue;
379 QMGR_ENTRY *entry;
380 DSN dsn;
381
382 /*
383 * Find out if this delivery process is really available. Once elected,
384 * the delivery process is supposed to express its happiness. If there is
385 * a problem, wipe the pending deliveries for this transport. This
386 * routine runs in response to an external event, so it does not run
387 * while some other queue manipulation is happening.
388 */
389 if (stream == 0 || qmgr_deliver_initial_reply(stream) != 0) {
390#if 0
391 whatsup = concatenate(transport->name,
392 " mail transport unavailable", (char *) 0);
393 qmgr_transport_throttle(transport,
394 DSN_SIMPLE(&dsn, "4.3.0", whatsup));
395 myfree(whatsup);
396#else
397 qmgr_transport_throttle(transport,
398 DSN_SIMPLE(&dsn, "4.3.0",
399 "mail transport unavailable"));
400#endif
401 qmgr_defer_transport(transport, &dsn);
402 if (stream)
403 (void) vstream_fclose(stream);
404 return;
405 }
406
407 /*
408 * Find a suitable queue entry. Things may have changed since this
409 * transport was allocated. If no suitable entry is found,
410 * unceremoniously disconnect from the delivery process. The delivery
411 * agent request reading routine is prepared for the queue manager to
412 * change its mind for no apparent reason.
413 */
414 if ((queue = qmgr_queue_select(transport)) == 0
415 || (entry = qmgr_entry_select(queue)) == 0) {
416 (void) vstream_fclose(stream);
417 return;
418 }
419
420 /*
421 * Send the queue file info and recipient info to the delivery process.
422 * If there is a problem, wipe the pending deliveries for this transport.
423 * This routine runs in response to an external event, so it does not run
424 * while some other queue manipulation is happening.
425 */
426 if (qmgr_deliver_send_request(entry, stream) < 0) {
427 qmgr_entry_unselect(queue, entry);
428#if 0
429 whatsup = concatenate(transport->name,
430 " mail transport unavailable", (char *) 0);
431 qmgr_transport_throttle(transport,
432 DSN_SIMPLE(&dsn, "4.3.0", whatsup));
433 myfree(whatsup);
434#else
435 qmgr_transport_throttle(transport,
436 DSN_SIMPLE(&dsn, "4.3.0",
437 "mail transport unavailable"));
438#endif
439 qmgr_defer_transport(transport, &dsn);
440 /* warning: entry and queue may be dangling pointers here */
441 (void) vstream_fclose(stream);
442 return;
443 }
444
445 /*
446 * If we get this far, go wait for the delivery status report.
447 */
448 qmgr_deliver_concurrency++;
449 entry->stream = stream;
450 event_enable_read(vstream_fileno(stream),
451 qmgr_deliver_update, (void *) entry);
452
453 /*
454 * Guard against broken systems.
455 */
456 event_request_timer(qmgr_deliver_abort, (void *) entry, var_daemon_timeout);
457}
